intro: Guatteria toralak, commonly known as the red-berried evergreen, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Lauraceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of fragrant white flowers. The plant produces small, red berries that are edible and often consumed by various bird species. Guatteria toralak thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. Its botanical features make it an important component of the ecological diversity in its native habitats.
